title: Sarah Lancashire had Welsh accent for 6 months to prepare for new role
text:
Sarah Lancashire plays Polly in The Accident (Picture: Channel 4)

Sarah Lancashire spoke with a Welsh accent for six months in preparation for her new role.

We’re used to hearing about actors going method for their next part, and Lancashire, 54, went the extra mile to perfect her character.

The Happy Valley star puts on a pretty spot on accent for drama series The Accident, which she revealed took months to perfect.

In order to make sure she was on point, she spoke with a Welsh accent on set and even at home with her family over Christmas last year.

She explained to press: ‘Six months of Welshness with my family and everything.

‘They’re so used to it. That’s the downside of living with an actor is that you live with their work as well. It’s quite normal in my house.’

Director Sandra Goldbacher was full of praise for the star for perfecting her character’s speech.

‘It wasn’t just a Welsh accent,’ she said, ‘it was Polly’s voice and specific to her.’

The Channel 4 drama, written by Jack Thorne, looks at the fall out after a tragic event in a small Welsh community.

It is the third and final part in Jack’s trilogy of dramas following National Treasure and Kiri. The three dramas cover important social issues: gender, race and class.

Joanna Scanlan, Mark Lewis Jones and Sidse Babett Knudsen also star.

Metro.co.uk got a chance to watch the first episode, and it’s as hard-hitting and disturbing as Jack’s other work with an incredible performance from Lancashire.

The Accident airs later this month on Channel 4.
